slides.title: What is cloud computing?
content: Cloud computing is the delivery of computing services over the internet ('the cloud')

slides.title: Think of it as Pizza as a Service üçï
content: Key Point: Just like you don't need a pizza oven at home, you don't usually need servers in your office!

slides.title: Cloud Service Models
content: Let's Stick to Our Pizza Analogy!
- Example: Amazon EC2 - your virtual kitchen!
- Like having the kitchen and basic ingredients

slides.title: Understanding Computer Networks - The OSI Model
content: It's Just Like a Postal System! üì¨
Think of sending a letter to your friend:
- Like the actual roads and paths
- In networks: Actual cables and wireless signals
Layer 2 (Data Link) - The Local Post Office
- Like addressing letters to local addresses
- In networks: MAC addresses, local network
- 'How do devices talk within the same neighborhood?'
- Like the system that routes between cities
- Famous example: 'How does a letter get from New York to LA?'
- Like choosing between regular mail or express delivery
- UDP: Like regular mail (faster but no guarantees)
- 'How do we ensure the package arrives correctly?'
- Like the actual message you write
- 'What are you actually trying to communicate?'

slides.title: Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
content: Your Private City in the Cloud üåÜ

slides.title: IP Addresses & Subnets
content: Think of a Large Office Building üè¢
- Like room numbers in a building
- Public IP: The building's street address
- Private IP: The room number inside
- Like dividing the building into departments
- Each floor has its own numbering system
